architecture.caption: Fig. 1. Given a slide image containing N patches {Xi}Ni=1, our framework predicts gene expression for both seen (Cs) and unseen (Cu) gene types. We have four stages: 1)Nuclei Distribution Aware Image Feature Extractor fuses each patch’s global tissue semantics and nuclei spatial distributions; 2)Pathology-Guided Genomic Prompter aligns LLM-generated gene descriptions {Tc} with image features through dual stream prompt learning. 3)Adaptive Semantic Interaction Graph models gene dependencies via topk semantic neighbor selection and weighted feature aggregation. 4)Gene Expression Prediction refines patch features via GraphSAGE network and computes expression values through dot products between enhanced features and gene embeddings.
